intro: Sticherus strictissimus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sticherus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Sticherus strictissimus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage.
